{"step_by_step_thinking": "The maxillary first molar is located in the upper jaw. According to Document [3], infections originating in the maxillary first or second molar can spread to the buccal side more frequently. Document [2] also mentions that infections originating in either maxillary or mandibular teeth can spread into the buccal space. Therefore, it is likely that an infection from the maxillary first molar would drain into the buccal space.", "answer_choice": "C. Buccal space"}
